description.narrative: Snowman Logistics Limited (Snowman or the Company) is an integrated temperature-controlled logistics (TCL) provider with a pan-India presence. Its primary business lines are: Storage: Snowman provides temperature controlled storage services to a number of industries. It has an aggregate capacity of 33,400 pallets spread over 18 locations. Transportation: Snowman offers temperature controlled transportation services for both long distance transportation and regional distribution to individual retail hubs, with its fleet of 158 reefer vehicles. Consignment agency: Snowmans offerings under this division include a range of supply chain services including inventory management, order collection, etc. As part of this Project, Snowman proposes to set up storage facilities at two new locations in Orissa and Gujarat (the Project).

The Project involves the expansion of one of the few organized operators in the TCL industry in India and is expected to have the following key development impacts: (a) Development of critical infrastructure: The Project involves the building of efficient storage and distribution infrastructure, which is currently lacking in the Indian agriculture supply chain. The expansion will help to lower logistics costs and reduce product wastage in the agriculture sector in India. (b) Frontier (LIS) growth: Part of the investment for the Project will take place in the low-income state of Orissa; (c) Enhancing competitiveness: The Project will strengthen the competitive advantage of an emerging logistics player, helping them become a market leader; (d) Demonstration effect: IFC''s investment will have a demonstration effect, encouraging additional private investments in the logistics sector.
